Description: Bowl. Inscription. Made of glazed and white, black slipware pottery (red).
Curator's comments: Parallel: J. Soustiel, La céramique islamique (Fribourg 1985) fig. 46.
Bibliographic references: Porter 2003 / Mightier than the sword: Arabic script - beauty and meaning (7) (listed as 1948,1009.2)
Lane 1947 / Early Islamic Pottery: Mesopotamia, Egypt and Persia (fig.15.A)
Porter & Barakat 2004 / Mightier than the Sword: Arabic Script: Beauty and Meaning (16) (listed as 1948,1009.02)
Pinder-Wilson 1952 / Recent Acquisitions of Islamic Pottery (p.81)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2015 – 2016 4 Dec – 29 May, National Museum of Singapore, ‘Treasures of the World’s Cultures’ 2012-2013 Nov-Feb, Kunsthalle, Bonn, 'Treasures of the World's Cultures' 2012 April-Aug, Abu Dhabi, Manarat Al Saadiyat, 'Treasures of the World’s Cultures' 2009-2010 11 Dec-10 May, Madrid, Canal de Isabel II, 'Treasures of the World’s Cultures' 2009 1 May-20 Sep, Victoria, Royal BC Museum, 'Treasures of the World's Cultures' 2004 7 Jan-7 Apr, Kuala Lumpur, Islamic Arts Museum Malaysia, 'Mightier than the Sword' 2003 22 Mar-25 May, University of Melbourne, Ian Potter Museum of Art, 'Mightier than the Sword'
Acquisition notes: OA register: "Purchased from A. Haskell, as agent for Mme. Mousa".
